events.title: AWS Cloud Hackathon 2025
events.description: Build scalable cloud solutions in 24 hours! Teams will compete to create innovative applications using AWS services. Prizes include internship opportunities and AWS credits. Beginners welcome with mentorship available.

events.title: Blockchain Development Workshop
events.description: Learn to build decentralized applications (dApps) on Ethereum. Hands-on coding session covering smart contracts, Web3.js, and Solidity fundamentals. Laptop required.

events.title: ARES Rocket Design Competition
events.description: Design and build model rockets for our annual competition! Teams will present designs, build prototypes, and launch at the final event. Engineering students from all disciplines welcome.

events.title: Python for Data Science Bootcamp
events.description: Intensive 3-day bootcamp covering pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, and scikit-learn. Build real-world projects including predictive models and data visualizations. Certificate provided.

events.title: Biomedical Innovation Hackathon
events.description: Solve healthcare challenges using technology! Work with medical students and engineers to prototype solutions for patient care, diagnostics, or health monitoring. Mentors from industry partners.

events.title: Investment Banking Career Panel
events.description: Hear from analysts and associates at top investment banks including Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, and Macquarie. Q&A session followed by networking with pizza and drinks.

events.title: Women in Finance Mentorship Night
events.description: Connect with senior women in banking, consulting, and fintech. Speed mentoring sessions, career advice, and discussion on breaking barriers in male-dominated industries.

events.title: Big 4 Accounting Recruitment Info Session
events.description: Representatives from PwC, Deloitte, EY, and KPMG will present graduate programs, internship opportunities, and application tips. Resume review stations available.

events.title: Actuarial Career Pathways Workshop
events.description: Explore diverse career paths beyond traditional actuarial roles: data science, risk management, consulting. Alumni panel and case study practice for interviews.

events.title: Startup Founder Fireside Chat
events.description: Meet founders of successful Melbourne startups. Hear their journey from idea to funding to scale. Topics: MVP development, pitch decks, investor relations, and resilience.

events.title: AIESEC Global Internship Fair
events.description: Discover international internship opportunities in 120+ countries. Work abroad in areas like education, youth empowerment, and sustainable development. Application help on-site.

events.title: Beta Alpha Psi Professional Development
events.description: Enhance your professional skills with workshops on Excel modeling, PowerPoint presentations, and business communication. Earn points toward BAP honors membership.
events.club_name: Beta Alpha Psi â€“ Unimelb Chapter

events.title: Bollywood Night: Dance & Dine
events.description: Celebrate Indian culture with Bollywood dance performances, traditional food, and henna art. DJ playing latest hits. Dress in your best ethnic wear for a costume contest!

events.title: Bubble Tea Crawl: Exploring Melbourne CBD
events.description: Visit 5 of Melbourne's best bubble tea shops in one afternoon! Vote for your favorite flavors, make new friends, and get exclusive discounts at each location.

events.title: Arab Culture Festival
events.description: Experience Arab hospitality with traditional food, music, and storytelling. Learn Arabic calligraphy, try on traditional clothing, and enjoy performances of dabke dancing.

events.title: Cambodian New Year Celebration
events.description: Ring in the Khmer New Year with traditional games, food stalls, and classical Apsara dance performances. Learn about Cambodian traditions and enjoy complimentary traditional desserts.

events.title: Cantonese Movie Night: Classic Hong Kong Cinema
events.description: Watch iconic Cantonese films with English subtitles. Free popcorn and snacks. Discussion session afterward about the golden age of Hong Kong cinema.

events.title: Anime Trivia & Cosplay Contest
events.description: Test your anime knowledge and show off your cosplay! Trivia rounds covering classic and current series. Prizes for best cosplay in different categories. Photo booth available.

events.title: Craft Beer Tasting Evening
events.description: Sample craft beers from Melbourne's independent breweries. Learn about brewing processes, flavor profiles, and beer-food pairings. Must be 18+ with valid ID.

events.title: Speed Friendship: Meet New People
events.description: Meet dozens of new people in one night through structured speed-friend dating style conversations. Perfect for international students or anyone wanting to expand their social circle.

events.title: Board Game Marathon
events.description: 12-hour board game marathon featuring strategy games, party games, and card games. Bring your own games or try our library of 100+ games. Food trucks on-site.

events.title: Biomedicine Exam Revision Workshop
events.description: Intensive revision for BIOM20002 covering all semester content. Practice questions, exam tips, and group study sessions led by high-achieving students.

events.title: SWOTVAC Study Sessions with Free Coffee
events.description: Quiet study space with free coffee, snacks, and study resources. Take breaks to chat with peers and destress before exams. Open 8am-10pm daily during SWOTVAC.

events.title: Statistics Bootcamp: From Basics to Advanced
events.description: Comprehensive stats review covering probability, distributions, hypothesis testing, and regression. Ideal for students in multiple disciplines. Practice datasets provided.

events.title: Agriculture Research Symposium
events.description: Student presentations on current research in sustainable agriculture, food security, and climate adaptation. Poster session and networking with faculty.

events.title: Peer Tutoring Drop-in: Math & Science
events.description: Free drop-in tutoring for calculus, physics, chemistry, and biology. No appointment needed. Bring your questions and practice problems.

events.title: Sunrise Yoga on South Lawn
events.description: Start your day with gentle yoga flow. All levels welcome. Bring your own mat or borrow one of ours. Followed by healthy breakfast and meditation.

events.title: Mental Health First Aid Training
events.description: Learn to recognize and respond to mental health challenges in yourself and others. Certified course covering anxiety, depression, and crisis intervention.

events.title: Social Soccer Tournament
events.description: Friendly 5v5 soccer tournament for all skill levels. Form a team or join as individual. BBQ lunch provided. Register teams in advance.

events.title: Meditation & Mindfulness Workshop
events.description: Learn practical meditation techniques to reduce stress and improve focus. Suitable for beginners. Includes guided meditation, breathing exercises, and Q&A.

events.title: Fitness Bootcamp: Get Exam Ready
events.description: High-intensity workout sessions to boost energy and reduce exam stress. Monday and Wednesday mornings. All fitness levels welcome. First week free!

events.title: Orchestra Concert: Classical Masterpieces
events.description: Biomedicine Students' Orchestra performs works by Beethoven, Mozart, and Tchaikovsky. Free entry. Support talented student musicians!

events.title: Ceramics Workshop: Beginner Pottery
events.description: Learn hand-building and wheel-throwing techniques. Create your own bowl, mug, or sculpture. All materials provided. Take home your fired piece in 2 weeks.

events.title: Acoustic Open Mic Night
events.description: Showcase your musical talent or enjoy performances by student artists. Sign up for 10-minute slots. All genres welcome. Supportive audience guaranteed!

events.title: D&D Campaign Night: Build Your Character
events.description: New campaign starting! Learn Dungeons & Dragons or bring your experienced character. Dungeon masters available for multiple tables. Snacks provided.

events.title: Student Short Film Festival
events.description: Screenings of student-made short films across genres: drama, comedy, documentary, experimental. Filmmaker Q&A after each block. Vote for audience favorite!

events.title: Animal Rights Campaign Workshop
events.description: Learn effective advocacy strategies for animal welfare. Topics: factory farming, animal testing, wildlife conservation. Plan upcoming campaign actions.

events.title: Community Volunteering: Food Bank
events.description: Volunteer at local food bank sorting donations and packing food parcels for families in need. Morning or afternoon shifts available. Transport provided.

events.title: Environmental Action: Tree Planting Day
events.description: Help restore native vegetation in local parklands. All equipment provided. Learn about indigenous plants and meet environmentally-minded students.

events.title: Human Rights Discussion Forum
events.description: Monthly discussion on current human rights issues: refugee rights, indigenous justice, freedom of expression. Guest speakers and open debate format.

events.title: Charity Knitting: Beanies for Homeless
events.description: Join our knitting circle creating beanies and scarves for homeless shelters. Beginners welcome - we'll teach you! Yarn and needles provided.

events.title: Car Enthusiast Meet & Greet
events.description: Show off your ride or admire other student cars! Casual meet-up at Royal Exhibition Building carpark. Photo ops, car chat, and cruise afterward.

events.title: Book Club: Contemporary Fiction Discussion
events.description: Monthly book club discussing "Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow" by Gabrielle Zevin. Newcomers welcome! Light refreshments provided.

events.title: Interfaith Dialogue Dinner
events.description: Share a meal and learn about different faith traditions. Representatives from Christian, Muslim, Buddhist, Jewish, and Hindu communities. All welcome regardless of beliefs.

events.title: China-Australia Friendship Gala
events.description: Cultural showcase celebrating ties between China and Australia. Performances, food stalls, cultural exhibitions, and networking opportunities.

events.title: Afghan Culture Night: Stories & Cuisine
events.description: Experience Afghan hospitality with traditional food, music, and storytelling. Learn about Afghan history and contemporary culture. Everyone welcome!

events.title: Bangladeshi Language Exchange
events.description: Learn basic Bengali phrases and teach your language! Interactive session with games, music, and Bengali sweets. Great for making international friends.
